metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4608 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** Multiple integer overflows in the lzo1x_decompress_safefunction in lib/lzo/lzo1x_decompress_safe.c in the LZO decompressor in theLinux kernel before 3.15.2 allow context-dependent attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted Literal Run.  NOTE: theauthor of the LZO algorithms says "the Linux kernel is *not* affected;media hype."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-40.69
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-40.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-40.69').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
